abstracts.abstract:
Existing law requires every employer to keep posted conspicuously at the place of work, if practicable, or otherwise where it can be seen as employees come or go to their places of work, or at the office or nearest agency for payment kept by the employer, a notice specifying the regular pay days and the time and place of payment, in accordance with specified provisions relating to the payment of wages to employees in various occupations.

This bill would make nonsubstantive changes to the provision requiring every employer to keep posted a notice specifying the regular pay days and the time and place of payment, as described above.

extras.impact_clause: An act to amend Section 207 of the Labor Code, relating to employment.
